message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.LG 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CV (Computer Vision) - The paper focuses on real-time 3D mapping and semantic labeling of the local environment from an ego-centric RGB-D video-stream with 3D gaze point estimation from head mounted eye tracking glasses. This involves various computer vision techniques such as object detection, semantic segmentation, and gaze estimation. 
2. cs.RO (Robotics) - The paper discusses the use of Semantic Simultaneous Localization And Mapping (Semantic SLAM) which is a popular technique in robotics for mapping and localization. The system can find and track objects both inside and outside the user field-of-view in 3D from multiple perspectives which is relevant to robotics applications. 
3. cs.GR (Graphics) - The paper involves 3D scene reconstruction and visualization which is a common topic in computer graphics. The semantic labeling of the environment can also be useful for graphics applications such as virtual reality and augmented reality. 
4. cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) - The paper discusses the use of head mounted eye tracking glasses for gaze estimation which is relevant to human-computer interaction. The system can also be useful for understanding human behavior in unconstrained every-day tasks. 
5. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper involves the use of machine learning techniques such as semantic segmentation and object detection for 3D scene reconstruction and gaze classification.
